info.name: Documentations for test project
info.description:
# Project Overview

Welcome to _Test project_

This project is for test purpose.

## Technologies Used

- Django
    
- Django Rest Framework
    
- Django Djoser
    

## Getting Started

### Prerequisites

Latest Python installed on your machine.

### Installation

1. Clone the repo in your machine.
    
2. Open the terminal the the directory where the repo is cloned.
    
3. Create an environment folder here by following this commands by assuming env is the folder name:  
    python -m venv env
    
4. Now activate the environment by entering this commands:  
    env\\Scripts\\activate
    
5. Now install all the dependencies for backend:  
    pip install -r requirements.txt
    
6. Now enter this commands for Database migration python manage.py makemigrations, python manage.py migrate
    
7. Now create a super user so that you can monitor the API making the changes by entering this command and adding the data python manage.py createsuperuser
    
8. Now run the backend server by entering: python manage.py runserver
    
9. If everything goes right you will see a link on the terminal something like this: 127.0.0.1:8000
    
10. Now this will be your backend domain for your API testings.
    

### Use this link in postman or your frontend projects. You'll find the API documentation in the repository.

item.name: Users

request.description:
In the Authorization field you will see a token have been used. This the the acces token which we got after logging in. When we need to use this field we need to add that token in Authorization field something like this

JWT eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJ0b2tlbl90eXBlIjoiYWNjZXNzIiwiZXhwIjoxNzM2MzIwNDM3LCJpYXQiOjE3MzExMzY0MzcsImp0aSI6IjcxYTBkYTU0YjI2ZTQ2MzY5ZWFiMjc3YjFkODY3YWNjIiwidXNlcl9pZCI6N30.bbCJJqw6L27HVjUoxicecw7O4X0ODCBNEC-X7c7YffQ

  
Remeber to add "JWT" before the token. There is an example below.
